intro: Clidemia vegaensis, commonly known as the Vega's mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests and wetlands. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to thrive in humid, tropical climates. Clidemia vegaensis is an important component of the local flora, contributing to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
